title: Lifelogging As An Extreme Form of Personal Information Management -- What Lessons To Learn. (arXiv:2401.05767v1 [cs.IR])
abstract: Personal data includes the digital footprints that we leave behind as part of our everyday activities, both online and offline in the real world. It includes data we collect ourselves, such as from wearables, as well as the data collected by others about our online behaviour and activities. Sometimes we are able to use the personal data we ourselves collect, in order to examine some parts of our lives but for the most part, our personal data is leveraged by third parties including internet companies, for services like targeted advertising and recommendations. Lifelogging is a form of extreme personal data gathering and in this article we present an overview of the tools used to manage access to lifelogs as demonstrated at the most recent of the annual Lifelog Search Challenge benchmarking workshops. translated_title: Lifelogging作为极致个人信息管理的一种形式 -- 需要学习的教训
translated_abstract: 个人数据包括我们在日常活动中留下的数字足迹，无论是在线还是离线的真实世界中。它包括我们自己收集的数据，例如来自可穿戴设备的数据，以及他人收集的有关我们在线行为和活动的数据。有时候我们能够使用我们自己收集的个人数据，以便检查我们生活的某些方面，但在大多数情况下，我们的个人数据被第三方，包括互联网公司，用于定向广告和推荐等服务。Lifelogging是一种极端个人数据收集的形式，在本文中，我们介绍了在最近一次Lifelog搜索挑战基准测试研讨会上展示的用于管理对Lifelogs的访问的工具的概述。在这里，实验系统通过真实用户展示了实时信息搜索任务。这些系统能力的概述展示了访问Lifelog的各种可能性。
tldr: 本文介绍了Lifelogging作为极致个人信息管理的形式，探讨了个人数据的搜集和访问方式，并呼吁对第三方使用个人数据的审慎性。
en_tdlr: This article presents Lifelogging as an extreme form of personal information management, discussing the collection and access methods of personal data, and calling for caution in the use of personal data by third parties.
